verses.verse: "Listen<WH8085> to me, you who pursue<WH7291> righteousness,<WH6664> Who seek<WH1245> the Lord:<WH3068> Look<WH5027> to the rock<WH6697> from which you were hewn,<WH2672> And to the quarry<WH953> <WH4718> from which you were dug.<WH5365>

"Look<WH5027> to Abraham<WH85> your father, And to Sarah<WH1> who gave<WH8283> birth<WH9123> to you in pain;<WH9123> When<WH9123> [he was] one<WH3588> I called<WH259> him, Then I blessed<WH7121> him and multiplied<WH1288> him."

Indeed,<WH3588> the Lord<WH3068> will comfort<WH5162> Zion;<WH6726> He will comfort<WH5162> all<WH3605> her waste<WH2723> places.<WH2723> And her wilderness<WH4057> He will make<WH7760> like Eden,<WH5731> And her desert<WH6160> like the garden<WH1588> of the Lord;<WH3068> Joy<WH8342> and gladness<WH8057> will be found<WH4672> in her, Thanksgiving<WH8426> and sound<WH6963> of a melody.<WH2172>

"Pay<WH7181> attention<WH7181> to Me, O My people;<WH5971> And give<WH238> ear<WH238> to Me, O My nation;<WH3816> For a law<WH8451> will go<WH3318> forth<WH3318> from Me, And I will set<WH7280> My justice<WH4941> for a light<WH216> of the peoples.<WH5971>

"My righteousness<WH6664> is near,<WH7138> My salvation<WH3468> has gone<WH3318> forth,<WH3318> And My arms<WH2220> will judge<WH8199> the peoples;<WH5971> The coastlands<WH339> will wait<WH6960> for Me, And for My arm<WH2220> they will wait<WH3176> expectantly.<WH3176>

"Lift<WH5375> up your eyes<WH5869> to the sky,<WH8064> Then look<WH5027> to the earth<WH776> beneath<WH4480>;<WH8478> For the sky<WH8064> will vanish<WH9263> like smoke,<WH6227> And the earth<WH776> will wear<WH1086> out like a garment,<WH899> And its inhabitants<WH3427> will die<WH4191> in like<WH3644> manner,<WH3654> But My salvation<WH3444> shall be forever,<WH5769> And My righteousness<WH6666> shall not wane.<WH2865>

"Listen<WH8085> to Me, you who know<WH3045> righteousness,<WH6664> A people<WH5971> in whose heart<WH3820> is My law;<WH8451> Do not fear<WH3372> the reproach<WH2781> of man,<WH582> Neither<WH408> be dismayed<WH2865> at their revilings.<WH1421>

"For the moth<WH6211> will eat<WH398> them like a garment,<WH899> And the grub<WH5580> will eat<WH398> them like wool.<WH6785> But My righteousness<WH6666> shall be forever,<WH5769> And My salvation<WH3444> to all<WH1755> generations.<WH1755>"

Awake,<WH5782> awake,<WH5782> put<WH3847> on strength,<WH5797> O arm<WH2220> of the Lord;<WH3068> Awake<WH5782> as in the days<WH3117> of old,<WH6924> the generations<WH1755> of long<WH5769> ago.<WH5769> Was it not Thou who cut<WH2672> Rahab<WH7293> in pieces,<WH2672> Who pierced<WH9135> the dragon<WH8577>?

Was it not Thou who dried<WH9162> up the sea,<WH3220> The waters<WH4325> of the great<WH7227> deep;<WH8415> Who made<WH7760> the depths<WH4615> of the sea<WH3220> a pathway<WH1870> For the redeemed<WH1350> to cross<WH5674> over<WH5674>?

So the ransomed<WH6299> of the Lord<WH3068> will return,<WH7725> And come<WH935> with joyful<WH7440> shouting<WH7440> to Zion;<WH6726> And everlasting<WH5769> joy<WH8057> [will be] on their heads.<WH7218> They will obtain<WH5381> gladness<WH8342> and joy,<WH8057> And sorrow<WH3015> and sighing<WH585> will flee<WH5127> away.

"I, even I, am He who comforts<WH5162> you. Who<WH4310> are you that you are afraid<WH3372> of man<WH582> who dies,<WH4191> And of the son<WH1121> of man<WH120> who is made<WH5414> like grass;<WH2682>

That you have forgotten<WH7911> the Lord<WH3068> your Maker,<WH6213> Who stretched<WH5186> out the heavens,<WH8064> And laid<WH3245> the foundations<WH3245> of the earth;<WH776> That you fear<WH6342> continually<WH8548> all<WH3605> day<WH3117> long because<WH4480> <WH6440> of the fury<WH2534> of the oppressor,<WH6693> As he makes<WH3559> ready<WH3559> to destroy<WH7843>? But where<WH346> is the fury<WH2534> of the oppressor<WH6693>?
"The exile<WH6808> will soon<WH4116> be set<WH6605> free,<WH6605> and will not die<WH4191> in the dungeon,<WH7845> nor<WH3808> will his bread<WH3899> be lacking.<WH2637>
"For I am the Lord<WH3068> your God,<WH430> who stirs<WH9541> up the sea<WH3220> and its waves<WH1530> roar<WH1993> (the Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> is His name<WH8034>).

"And I have put<WH7760> My words<WH1697> in your mouth,<WH6310> and have covered<WH3680> you with the shadow<WH6738> of My hand,<WH3027> to establish<WH5193> the heavens,<WH8064> to found<WH3245> the earth,<WH776> and to say<WH559> to Zion,<WH6726> 'You are My people.<WH5971>'"

Rouse<WH5782> yourself!<WH5782> Rouse<WH5782> yourself!<WH5782> Arise,<WH6965> O Jerusalem,<WH3389> You who<WH834> have drunk<WH8354> from the Lord's hand<WH3027> the cup<WH3563> of His anger;<WH2534> The chalice<WH3563> <WH6907> of reeling<WH8653> you have drained<WH4680> to the dregs.<WH6907>

There<WH369> is none<WH369> to guide<WH5095> her among<WH4480> all<WH3605> the sons<WH1121> she has borne;<WH3205> Nor<WH369> is there<WH369> one<WH369> to take<WH2388> her by the hand<WH3027> among<WH4480> all<WH3605> the sons<WH1121> she has reared.<WH1431>

These<WH2007> two<WH8147> things<WH8147> have befallen<WH7122> you; Who<WH4310> will mourn<WH5110> for you? The devastation<WH7701> and destruction,<WH7667> famine<WH7458> and sword;<WH2719> How<WH4310> shall I comfort<WH5162> you?

Your sons<WH1121> have fainted,<WH5968> They lie<WH7901> [helpless] at the head<WH7218> of every<WH3605> street,<WH2351> Like an antelope<WH8377> in a net,<WH9261> Full<WH4392> of the wrath<WH2534> of the Lord,<WH3068> The rebuke<WH1606> of your God.<WH430>
Therefore,<WH3651> please<WH4994> hear<WH8085> this,<WH384> you afflicted,<WH6041> Who are drunk,<WH7937> but not with wine: <WH3196>

Thus<WH3541> says<WH559> your Lord,<WH136> the Lord,<WH3068> even your God<WH430> Who contends<WH7378> for His people,<WH5971> "Behold,<WH2009> I have taken<WH3947> out of your hand<WH3027> the cup<WH3563> of reeling;<WH8653> The chalice<WH3563> <WH6907> of My anger,<WH2534> You will never<WH3808> drink<WH8354> it again.<WH3254>

"And I will put<WH7760> it into the hand<WH3027> of your tormentors,<WH3013> Who<WH834> have said<WH559> to you, 'Lie<WH7812> down<WH7812> that we may walk<WH5674> over<WH5674> you.' You have even made<WH7760> your back<WH1460> like the ground,<WH776> And like the street<WH2351> for those who walk<WH5674> over<WH5674> [it]."
